creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: four full lines delicate calligrahpy, plus two broken lines at L
inscription: Anxiously having summoned the god to give him to drink of “upper-pond” water, / Pien Ch’ien has come again to cure me of my ill / Do not wonder that in mid-winter here in this hidden valley / The Mountain Spirit conjures in profusion the songs of orioles! / -- --Summer 1839, to cure the pain of my boils (AS)
markings: URC; LLCL: 好；幽; sticker R roller end: [Fugai 1839 / Callig]
title: (Taiga-style Calligraphy)
